name: market for recultivation, shale quarry | recultivation, shale quarry | Cutoff, U
description:
ecoQuery: https://ecoquery.ecoinvent.org/3.10/cutoff/dataset/11114/documentation

This is a market activity. Each market represents the consumption mix of a product in a given geography, connecting suppliers with consumers of the same product in the same geographical area. Markets group the producers and also the imports of the product (if relevant) within the same geographical area. They also account for transport to the consumer and for the losses during that process, when relevant.;This is the market for  'recultivation, shale quarry', in the Global geography.;This market contains no transport or losses, as they are irrelevant for the delivered product.;This is delivering the service of recultivation of a shale quarry mine. The process  represents the recultivation of 1 m2 of topsoil after shale quarry extraction with coverage of an assumed average thickness of 0.3 m and a density of 1400 kg/m3. The mass of topsoil per m2 is circa 420 kg, while the ratio of topsoil to extracted shale quarry is 0.26%. The service includes land transformation from mine to forest and the machines needed but it excludes the refill material.

This activity starts with the service generation.


This activity ends with the service supplied to its consumers. Transport or losses are considered irrelevant for this product.
category: E:Water supply; sewerage, waste management and remediation activities/39:Remediation activities and other waste management services/390:Remediation activities and other waste management services/3900:Remediation activities and other waste management services
